name: Boxwindow
description:
You are a brightly colored box. Dodge faintly colored boxes for as long as you can and hope to get a high score!
Use WASD, F to select menu stuff and R to reset.
Oh, and if you get to the top of the screen all currently placed boxes are destroyed. Hooray!

This game was made with the goal of being fun with as little flashiness as possible. No sounds, no animations,  heck, no real colors either. It also has a microscopically small file size of 1mb, so if you can read this description the game has probably loaded already.
Essentially, it's the idea of making a Minimum Viable Product stand into a fully enjoyable time waster in its own right.

However, there are still issues that will hopefully get ironed someday:
- Lack of arrow key support. Oh, the horror of AZERTY players...
- Being crushed by a grey box lacks impact and looks glitchy. Might make it slowly sink/squish behind the grey box instead of "phasing into the position".
- Limited to 4:3 aspect ratio...? In 2021...?
- Blurry text? Oh yeah, Bitmap text.
- Questionable cover image.
- Broken fullscreen!? And the default resolution is 480p!? (It's because I use a 768p screen, so the game looks alright to me)
- No mobile controls!?!?

Well, that's it. Let me know if the game's fun enough, or not.
And feel free to throw suggestions!
